Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL ?; PAINTED
Name: Decorated bowl
Description: This clay bowl is a typical example of the Meroitic ceramic of the 1st or 2nd century of our time. It comes from the excavations of J. Garstang at Meroe in 1909-1910. The decoration is composed of a series of identical motifs (cords?) linked by horizontal lines and defined by two border lines.
